object.name: InputChecklistTask
object.description: Describes a task to add to a checklist.
object.html_description: Describes a task to add to a checklist.
object.rst_description: Describes a task to add to a checklist.

annotations.description: Unique identifier of the task; must be positive and unique among all task identifiers currently present in the checklist
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier of the task; must be positive and unique among all task identifiers currently present in the checklist
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier of the task; must be positive and unique among all task identifiers currently present in the checklist
annotations.name: id

annotations.description: Text of the task; 1-100 characters after entities parsing
annotations.html_description: Text of the task; 1-100 characters after entities parsing
annotations.rst_description: Text of the task; 1-100 characters after entities parsing
annotations.name: text

annotations.description: Mode for parsing entities in the text. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the text. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.rst_description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the text. See `formatting options <https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options>`_ for more details.
annotations.name: parse_mode

annotations.description: List of special entities that appear in the text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode. Currently, only bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities are allowed.
annotations.html_description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode. Currently, only bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities are allowed.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode. Currently, only *bold*, *italic*, *underline*, *strikethrough*, *spoiler*, and *custom_emoji* entities are allowed.
annotations.name: text_entities
